intro: Lysinema lasianthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray flowers. Lysinema lasianthum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various invertebrates.
